item.title: France and Germany return to growth
item.description: Germany and France delivered a surprise boost to hopes that the eurozone is clawing its way back from recession as the region’s largest members said their economies grew in the second quarter after shrinking for a year

item.title: US data dim optimism on Wall Street
item.description: Worrying economic data took the shine off what was set to be an impressive rally on Wall Street after results from Wal-Mart had bolstered sentiment following an unexpected return to growth in France and Germany

item.title: Wal-Mart reports flat quarterly profits
item.description: International operations particularly the UK,helped Wal-Mart navigate difficult conditions in its second quarter, but profits at the world’s biggest retailer were held back by the strength of the US dollar

item.title: US foreclosure activity hits new record
item.description: Foreclosures activity in the US hit a new record in July, setting its third record in five months, RealtyTrac reported on Thursday

item.title: AB InBev sees switch to ‘value’ brands
item.description: Anheuser-Busch InBev, the world’s largest brewer warned the second half of the year would be weaker as it revealed better-than-expected second-quarter results

item.title: Fed holds steady on emergency measures
item.description: US Federal Reserve policymakers ended their two-day meeting on by keeping interest rates steady as expected, but extending the Fed’s $300bn programme to buy Treasury bonds until October

item.title: Rio Tinto plans IPO for US coal unit
item.description: Rio Tinto has made plans to list its US coal business in an initial public offering on the New York Stock Exchange before the end of the year

item.title: Growing risk appetite lifts global markets
item.description: Risk was back on the agenda on Thursday, as equity and commodity markets rallied strongly, while emerging market and high yield currencies were sought at the expense of the dollar and yen

item.title: Citi hires external help to probe management
item.description: US regulators have forced Citigroup to hire external consultants to consider whether its management is up to the job of leading the troubled bank out of the financial crisis

item.title: John Paulson bets on BofA with 2% stake
item.description: John Paulson, the hedge fund manager who made billions of dollars by betting against subprime mortgages and shorting bank stocks during the past two years, has bought close to 2 per cent of Bank of America in what appears to be a strong endorsement of a bellwether financial institution
